intro: Coccoloba alainii, commonly known as the Hawaiian nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
